meanings.definition: The state or quality of being kept hidden or concealed.
meanings.sent1: The supersecrecies of the treasure map kept us intrigued.
meanings.sent2: Government agencies often have supersecrecies to protect sensitive information.
meanings.sent3: The supersecrecies of the surprise party were almost ruined by a slip of the tongue.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes held a hint of supersecrecies, like she was hiding something magical.
meanings.sent5: The supersecrecies surrounding the ancient artifact added an air of mystery to the museum exhibit.

meanings.definition: Information or activities that are kept hidden or concealed.
meanings.sent1: The spy's mission involved uncovering the supersecrecies of the rival organization.
meanings.sent2: Whistleblowers play a crucial role in exposing corporate supersecrecies.
meanings.sent3: The supersecrecies of the forbidden recipe were finally revealed at the cooking competition.
meanings.sent4: His journal was a vault of emotional supersecrecies, locked away from prying eyes.
meanings.sent5: The diary contained the supersecrecies of a time traveler, detailing adventures beyond imagination.
